Grouped_Utterances: Hey, Ellie! I’ve had a bit of a rough week. I tried writing about my feelings, but it brought up a lot of emotions. I wrote about my dad and how angry I still feel. It made me cry, and I didn’t expect that. I think I want to write about my relationship with my mom and how that impacts me. Yeah, I think it’ll help me understand why I react the way I do sometimes. I feel hopeful. I think we’re starting to communicate better. Yeah, I’ve been less reactive. I think the meditation is helping a lot. I guess I’m still worried about my dad. I don’t know if I should reach out to him. I haven’t really thought that far ahead. I just feel conflicted.
I mentioned it to my girlfriend, and she was really supportive. She encouraged me to keep writing. We’ve been getting along better, actually. I think cooking together helped.
I’m scared of getting hurt again. I don’t want to open old wounds.
I felt a bit lighter, but also exhausted. It was overwhelming. It’s been hit or miss. Some nights are better than others, but I’m trying.
It’s okay to take your time with that decision. Maybe writing down your thoughts about it could help clarify how you feel.

I think that could help. I’ll try to be more disciplined about it. I’m glad to hear that. Let’s continue to work on your writing and sleep routine, and we can revisit the idea of reaching out to your dad when you feel ready.
